What does the alteration in composition from the planar to the chain-like compound achieve in terms of magnetic exchange?
data.answer: It changes the symmetry of the crystal and reduces the number of nearest neighbors, affecting the dimensionality of the magnetic exchange.

What is the significance of the g-factor anisotropy in determining the type of magnetic order in the compounds?
data.answer: The g-factor anisotropy helps to verify the equivalence of the magnetic and structural planes and chains, indicating the direction of highest electronic orbital overlap and the mediation of magnetic exchange.
